caption: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines schema attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
name: dictionary

admin_users.caption: Admin User
admin_users.description: The users that belong to the administrative group.

app_uid.caption: Application UID
app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the application that is associated with the event or object.

app_ver.caption: Application Version
app_ver.description: The version of the application that is associated with the event or object.

assignee.caption: Assignee
assignee.description: The name of the user who is assigned to the incident.

big_endian.caption: Big Endian
big_endian.description: A boolean indicating whether the most significant byte is stored/transmitted first.

blue_pixel.caption: Blue Pixel Info
blue_pixel.description: The information pertaining to how a blue pixel was transmitted.

channel.caption: Channel
channel.description: The channel that was used to update the component.

color_max.caption: Color Maximum
color_max.description: The maximum color value (with 'n' bits this would result in a 2^n-1 maximum value).

color_shift.caption: Color Shift
color_shift.description: The color shift value represents the number of shifts needed in order to get the color value in a pixel to the least significant bit.

creator_name.caption: Creator Name
creator_name.description: The name of the user who created the incident.

curr_ver.caption: Current Version
curr_ver.description: The updated version of the code, content, configuration or policy.

data_bucket.caption: Data Bucket
data_bucket.description: The name of the data bucket (e.g. bucket name for AWS/GCP and blob name for Azure).

days_left.caption: Days Left
days_left.description: The number of days that remain before the license or certificate expires.

detected_time.caption: Detection Time
detected_time.description: The time when the malware was detected.

displayed_text.caption: Displayed Text
displayed_text.description: The information that is displayed to the user that describes the impact of a client side override action.

domain_info.caption: Domain Information
domain_info.description: The registration information pertaining to a domain.

effective_time.caption: Effective Date
effective_time.description: The date and time that the specific policy and rule was applied and became operational.

email_uid.caption: Email UID
email_uid.description: The unique identifier of the email, used to correlate related email alert and activity events.

event_source.caption: Event Source
event_source.description: The event source from which the event originates.

exposed_port.caption: Port
exposed_port.description: The IP port number exposed by container. For example 0.0.0.0:49155-> <<exposed_port>>/tcp

facility.caption: Facility
facility.description: The subsystem or application that is providing the event data.

facility_detail.caption: Facility Detail
facility_detail.description: Additional detail about the source facility. For example, details could include a the name of a particular application instance (such as a database name) or a path to a monitored log file.

facility_uid.caption: Facility UID
facility_uid.description: The unique identifier of the facility.

frame_buffer.caption: Frame Buffer
frame_buffer.description: The frame buffer object describes the details pertaining to the color/pixel data associated with the computer display.

green_pixel.caption: Green Pixel Info
green_pixel.description: The information pertaining to how a green pixel was transmitted.

interpreter.caption: Interpreter
interpreter.description: The script interpreter used. For example: "CMD", "POWERSHELL", "VBSCRIPT", "JAVASCRIPT".

is_advertised.caption: Advertised
is_advertised.description: The indication of whether the TLS protocol is advertised by the SMTP server.

is_used.caption: Used
is_used.description: The indication of whether the TLS is used when sending email.

is_valid.caption: Valid
is_valid.description: The indication of whether the certificate is valid.

label.caption: Label
label.description: The label set for the policy.

loaded_module_name.caption: Loaded Module
loaded_module_name.description: The name of the module loaded by the service.

mem_allocated.caption: Allocated Memory
mem_allocated.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) allocated memory (in bytes).

mem_free.caption: Free Memory
mem_free.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) free memory (in bytes).

mem_max.caption: Maximum Memory
mem_max.description: The Java Virtual Machine® (JVM) maximum memory (in bytes).

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

num_network.caption: Scanned Network Items
num_network.description: The number of network items scanned.

num_registry.caption: Scanned Registry Items
num_registry.description: The number of registry items scanned.

num_resolutions.caption: Resolutions
num_resolutions.description: The number of items that were resolved.

num_violations.caption: Violations
num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, OpenShift, None.

os_service.caption: OS Service
os_service.description: The OS service that pertains to the event.

override_duration.caption: Override Duration
override_duration.description: The length in minutes for the override action to remain in place until restored upon expiration of time. If not provided it implies infinite duration of policy enforcement or until such time as another policy action occurs.

owner_email.caption: Owner Email
owner_email.description: The email address of the data owner.

pixel_bits.caption: Pixel Bits
pixel_bits.description: The number of bits per pixel.

policy_id.caption: SMTP TLS Policy
policy_id.description: The SMTP Transport Layer Security (TLS) policy.

prev_ver.caption: Previous Version
prev_ver.description: The pre-update version of the code, content, configuration or policy.

print_job.caption: Print Job
print_job.description: The name of the print or FAX job.

public_key_cert.caption: Public Key Certificate
public_key_cert.description: The Public Key Certificate used to prove the ownership of a public key.

quarantine_uid.caption: Quarantine UID
quarantine_uid.description: The unique identifier of the item that was quarantined or restored from quarantine.

recovery_key_uid.caption: Recovery Key UID
recovery_key_uid.description: The unique identifier of the recovery key of the volume.

red_pixel.caption: Red Pixel Info
red_pixel.description: The information pertaining to how a red pixel was transmitted.

response_action.caption: Response Action
response_action.description: The information protection response action taken.

rules.caption: Rules
rules.description: The additional rules that are associated with the policy.

scan_name.caption: Scan Name
scan_name.description:
The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example:
  • "Home office weekly user database scan"
  • "Scan folders for viruses"
  • "Full system virus scan"

99.caption: Other
99.description: The scan type is not mapped.

scan_uid.caption: Scan UID
scan_uid.description: The unique identifier of a scan job.

schedule_uid.caption: Schedule UID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

sender_email.caption: Sender Email
sender_email.description: The email address of the sender.

smtp_tls.caption: SMTP TLS
smtp_tls.description: The SMTP Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes.

session_uid.caption: Session UID
session_uid.description:
The unique ID of the user session, as reported by the OS.

Examples:
  • *nix: Aug 10 17:31:16 ip-192-168-1-1 systemd[1]: Started Session 222 of User ubuntu.
    • session_uid == 222
  • Windows: Logon ID: 0xd22e9734
    • session_uid == 0xd22e9734

start_type.caption: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of the service or startup application.

start_type_id.caption: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of the service or startup application.

10.caption: System Changed
10.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

3.caption: Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Window service control manager when a process calls the StartService function.

7.caption: Specific User Login
7.description: Started when on a specific user login.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

startup_app.caption: Startup Application
startup_app.description: The startup application that pertains to the event.

status_stack_trace.caption: Stack Trace
status_stack_trace.description: The list of calls that the application was making when an exception was thrown.

throughput_eps.caption: Events per Second
throughput_eps.description: The number of events processed per second.

throughput_kbps.caption: Kilobytes per Second
throughput_kbps.description: The number of kilobytes of data processed per second (kB/s).

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

true_color.caption: True Color
true_color.description: A boolean indicating whether to extract pixel values through red/green/blue intensities.

5.caption: Own Process
5.description: The application runs in its own process

6.caption: Shared Process
6.description: The application shares a process with other services

7.caption: Interactive
7.description: The service can interact with the desktop

9.caption: Autoload
9.description: The Mac OS X Autoload Application

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service type is not mapped. See the types attribute, which contains a data source specific values.

vnc_auth.caption: VNC Authentication
vnc_auth.description: The Virtual Network Computing (VNC) authentication object describes the VNC authentication values.

volume_uid.caption: Volume UID
volume_uid.description: The unique identifier of the volume.
